newsitem.title: USA: NHL ICE HOCKEY-JAGR AND LEMIEUX LEAD PENGUINS PAST ISLANDERS.
newsitem.headline: NHL ICE HOCKEY-JAGR AND LEMIEUX LEAD PENGUINS PAST ISLANDERS.

text.p: Jaromir Jagr notched his league-leading 37th and 38th goals in the first period and Mario Lemeiux collected four assists as the Pittsburgh Penguins beat the New York Islanders 5-2 on Friday.
The streaking Penguins have won six in a row and are 9-0-1 in their last 10 and 17-2-3 since November 21.
Pittsburgh goalie Patrick Lalime stopped 37 shots to remain unbeaten at 11-0-1 since being called up.

Lemieux's third assist, coming on Jagr's second goal, moved him past Bobby Clark into 13th place on the all-time assist list. Lemieux, who has 854 career assists, has two goals and 14 assists in his last four games.
"Our big guys just took over the game tonight," said Pittsburgh coach Ed Johnston. "When they're playing like that, they're awful, awful tough to stop.
"Jagr was a question mark," Johnston said. "He put on a pretty good demonstration for a guy who was sick."
Bryan Smolinski and Zigmund Palffy tallied for the Isles, losers of six in a row.
In Anaheim, Paul Kariya recorded his first career hat trick and added an assist to lead the Mighty Ducks to a 5-2 victory over the Buffalo Sabres.
Kariya broke a 1-1 tie late in the second period with a short-handed goal and snapped a 2-2 deadlock with his second of the game at 4:36 of the third.
After assisting on Teemu Selanne's 24th goal just 71 seconds later, Kariya completed the scoring and his hat trick with a powerplay marker at 9:06 of the third.
Buffalo's Dominik Hasek made 47 saves in a losing effort as the Ducks outshot the Sabres by a wide 52-21 margin.
At New Jersey, Tony Amonte, skating on a bruised left knee, scored with 20 seconds left to lift the Chicago Blackhawks into a 3-3 tie with the Devils.
Denis Pederson had a powerplay goal and an assist for the Devils, who blew a 3-1 lead. Eric Weinrich scored to move Chicago within one with 6:43 left in the second period.

The Blackhawks pulled goaltender Jeff Hackett in the final minute for an extra attacker and Amonte streaked into the New Jersey zone and beat Martin Brodeur with a low wrist shot for his team-leading 27th goal.
In Dallas, Keith Tkachuk and Mike Gartner each had a goal and two assists to lead Phoenix Coyotes to a 4-3 victory over the Stars.

Gartner and Tkachuk scored just under six minutes apart in the second period to put the Coyotes up 3-2. Jeremy Roenick added a powerplay tally at 8:06 of the third, which proved to be the game winner as Phoenix snapped a three-game slide.
Tkachuk, who leads Phoenix with 26 goals, has 14 goals and 22 points in his last 13 games.
Nikolai Khabibulin made 31 saves for Phoenix.
In Vancouver, Pavel Bure had a goal and two assists and Kirk McLean made 20 saves as the Canucks handed the Hartford Whalers their eight straight road loss with a 5-3 victory.

Bure, back on track after a slow start, scored the game-winner in the third and assisted on earlier goals by Alexander Mogilny and David Roberts. He has a seven-game points streak with seven goals and six assits.
Glen Wesley and Kevin Dineen tallied goals for Hartford, which is 0-6-1 in its last seven games.
